intro: Minuartia smejkalii, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and arid regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in limestone or gravelly habitats. It is adapted to harsh environments, showcasing features such as succulence and a compact growth form. Minuartia smejkalii is also known for its ability to survive in extreme conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
